title: How to Make Tater Tot Hotdish

steps.headline: Brown 1 pound of ground beef for about four servings.
steps.description: Onion always goes well with browned beef and garlic is often a good idea as well, not to mention salt and black pepper.

steps.headline: Choose your vegetable: beans, carrots, peas, corn, etc.
steps.description: One is enough, though a mix can be exciting, too. Mushrooms are good accompaniments to vegetables. Make sure the vegetables are well-thawed.

steps.headline: Choose your sauce: cream of mushroom and cream of celery are two old favorites.
steps.description: A can of cream of celery or mushroom soup works well and you can add it directly to the browned beef and vegetables. If the sauce is being made from a powder, follow the given directions and allow the sauce to become very thick.

steps.headline: Put the browned beef, vegetables, and sauce into a large glass cake pan.
steps.description: Mix well and spread them evenly across the pan.

steps.headline: Take frozen bite-size pieces of potato, preferably breaded, and place a layer of potatoes over the beef-veggie-sauce mix.
Pre-heat the oven to 350 °F (177 °C) (120 C).
steps.description: Plan on the dish cooking in the oven for about 1 hour. Check on the dish after about 30 minutes.

text: Brown 1 pound of ground beef for about four servings. Onion always goes well with browned beef and garlic is often a good idea as well, not to mention salt and black pepper. Choose your vegetable: beans, carrots, peas, corn, etc. One is enough, though a mix can be exciting, too. Mushrooms are good accompaniments to vegetables. Make sure the vegetables are well-thawed. Choose your sauce: cream of mushroom and cream of celery are two old favorites. A can of cream of celery or mushroom soup works well and you can add it directly to the browned beef and vegetables. If the sauce is being made from a powder, follow the given directions and allow the sauce to become very thick. Put the browned beef, vegetables, and sauce into a large glass cake pan. Mix well and spread them evenly across the pan. Take frozen bite-size pieces of potato, preferably breaded, and place a layer of potatoes over the beef-veggie-sauce mix.  Pre-heat the oven to 350 °F (177 °C) (120 C). Plan on the dish cooking in the oven for about 1 hour. Check on the dish after about 30 minutes. Serve and enjoy!
